<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Reverse Curse](/Feats.aspx?ID=3836) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 169</row>

**Archetype** [Curse Maelstrom](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=190)

**Prerequisites**
[Counter Curse](/Feats.aspx?ID=3834)

</column>

---

When you counter a [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38) or [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) effect, you send it back to destroy its originator. Whenever you succeed at the [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check to Counter Curse, the creature is affected by its own curse or misfortune effect, attempting a saving throw against its own DC if the effect allows a saving throw. In the case of a constant ability, such as a misfortune aura, the creature is affected only until the beginning of its next turn, when the ability reasserts itself.
name: Reverse Curse
